alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 17 at 2:59PM MDT until April 19 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM TUESDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS WITH AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Tuesday through Thursday continue to advertise a prolonged period of widespread critical fire weather conditions with strong westerly winds, low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. Tuesday will feature several hours of single digit humidity values, gusty westerly winds and high temperatures as much as 12 degrees above normal. While winds will diminish after sunset Tuesday, overnight humidity recovery will be poor nearly areawide, with most areas only recovering to 20 to 35 percent. Conditions are expected to worsen on Wednesday with strong westerly winds, continued low relative humidity and an unstable atmosphere. Widespread critical fire weather conditions will persist into Thursday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING... This includes the Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), West Central Mountains (Zone 105) and West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) across western NM, the Upper Rio Grande and Lower Chama River Valleys (Zone 121), the Sangre de Cristo Mountains below snowpack (Zone 122) as well as all of eastern New Mexico (Zones 104, 123, 125, and 126) from noon Tuesday through Tuesday evening and again Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...For Tuesday, west to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. For Wednesday, west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent, except up to 20 percent above 8500 feet each day. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
